Imports

shapes, basictypes, cameras, materials, pcg, geometry

Types

FlatRenderer = ref object of Renderer
A «flat» renderer. This renderer estimates the solution of the rendering equation by neglecting any contribution of the light. It just uses the pigment of each surface to determine how to compute the final radiance. 
OnOffRenderer = ref object of Renderer
  color*: Color
A on/off renderer. This renderer is mostly useful for debugging purposes, as it is really fast, but it produces boring images. 
PathTracer = ref object of Renderer
  pcg*: PCG
  num_of_rays*: int
  max_depth*: int
  russian_roulette_limit*: int
A simple path-tracing renderer. 
PointLightRenderer = ref object of Renderer
  ambient_color*: Color
A simple point-light renderer. 
Renderer = ref object of RootObj
  world*: World
  background_color*: Color
An object implementing a solver of the rendering equation.

method render(renderer: FlatRenderer; ray: Ray): Color {.locks: "unknown",

Estimate the radiance along a ray using FlatRenderer. 
method render(renderer: OnOffRenderer; ray: Ray): Color {.locks: "unknown",
    ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Estimate the radiance along a ray using OnOffRenderer. 
method render(renderer: PathTracer; ray: Ray): Color {.locks: "unknown",
    ...raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Estimate the radiance along a ray using PathTracer. The algorithm implemented here allows the caller to tune number of rays thrown at each iteration, as well as the maximum depth. It implements Russian roulette, so in principle it will take a finite time to complete the calculation even if you set max_depth to Inf. 
method render(renderer: PointLightRenderer; ray: Ray): Color {.locks: "unknown",
    ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Point light renderer.
